content:
Add a Date/Time Input Element to a FlexCard

Available beginning Winter '22.

From the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer.
From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Date/Time element onto the canvas.
Configure properties common to all Input elements:

In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field. See Bind a FlexCard Input Value to a Data Field.

In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.

Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.

Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.

In Help Text, enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field. This feature adds an info icon (i) next to the element's label, which when hovered over displays the text.

In Date Placeholder, enter temporary text that displays inside the input field.
In Time Placeholder, enter temporary text that displays inside the input field.
Click into Default Value to select a default input value from a merge field. Or, enter a value as plain text. Enter a default value in the format specified in Date Format and Time Format.

Update the Date Format. Default is MM-dd-yyyy, which displays as 12-03-2021. See date-fns format for format options.
Update the Time Format. Default is hh:mm a, which displays as 3:30 am or 3:30 pm. See date-fns format for format options.

Select a date in the past or future in the format specified in Date Format.
In Time Interval, update the time intervals from the default 30 to another increment.

To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action.
(Optional) To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.
(Optional) To style your element, click Style to open the Style panel, and see Style FlexCard Elements.
title: Adding Date/Time Input Element to FlexCard
